sen.j: 白鳳文化（はくほうぶんか）とは、645年（大化元年）の大化の改新から710年（和銅3年）の平城京遷都までの飛鳥時代に華咲いたおおらかな文化であり、法隆寺の建築・仏像などによって代表される飛鳥文化と、東大寺の仏像、唐招提寺の建築などによって代表される天平文化との中間に位置する。
sen.e: Hakuho culture is the graceful one which flourished between the Taika Reforms in 645 and the relocation of Heijo-kyo capital in 710, falling between Asuka culture represented by architecture and Buddha statue of Horyu-ji Temple and Tenpyo culture represented by Buddha statues of Todai-ji Temple and buildings of Toshodai-ji Temple.

Hakuho culture is a magnanimous culture which flourished between the Taika Reforms in 645 and the relocation of Heijo-kyo capital in 710, falling between the Asuka culture represented by the architecture and Buddha statues of Horyu-ji Temple and the Tenpyo culture represented by Buddha statues of Todai-ji Temple and buildings of Toshodai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: the graceful one→a magnanimous culture,statue→statues と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: Hakuho culture is a magnanimous culture which flourished between the Taika Reforms in 645 and the relocation of Heijo-kyo capital in 710, falling between the Asuka culture represented by the architecture and Buddha statues of Horyu-ji Temple and the Tenpyo culture represented by Buddha statues of Todai-ji Temple and buildings of Toshodai-ji Temple.

sen.j: なお、白鳳とは日本書紀に現れない元号（逸元号や私年号という）の一つである（しかし続日本紀には白鳳が記されている）。
sen.e: In addition, Hakuho is one of era names which don't appear in Chronicles of Japan (they are called 'Itsugango' or 'Shinengo') (however, Hakuo appears in Shoku Nihongi).
sen.cmt: 「逸元号」は「逸年号」の間違いではないかと思いますがそのまま訳しました。
sen.e: In addition, Hakuho is one of the era names which do not appear in Chronicles of Japan (called 'Itsugango' or 'Shinengo') (However, Hakuo appears in Shoku Nihongi.)
sen.cmt: the を補いました。don't→do not,カッコ内を修正しました。スペース、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: In addition, Hakuho is one of the era names which do not appear in Chronicles of Japan (called 'Itsugango' or 'Shinengo') (However, Hakuo appears in Shoku Nihongi.)

sen.j: 天武天皇の頃に使用されたと考えられており（天智天皇のときに使用されたとする説もある）、白鳳文化もこの時期に最盛期を迎えた。
sen.e: The era name of Hakuo is thought to have been used around the time of Emperor Tenmu (another theory is around the time of Emperor Tenchi), when Hakuho culture was at its best, too.
The era name of Hakuo is thought to have been used around the time of the Emperor Tenmu (another theory is around the time of the Emperor Tenchi), when the Hakuho culture was also at its best.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。スペースを修正しました。too→also としてオーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: The era name of Hakuo is thought to have been used around the time of the Emperor Tenmu (another theory is around the time of the Emperor Tenchi), when the Hakuho culture was also at its best.
characteristics
Characteristics
Characteristics

sen.j: 7世紀の終わり頃完成した、古代の都で最大の規模を誇り、条坊制を布いた本格的な中国風都城の藤原京を中心とした天皇や貴族中心の華やかな文化であった。
sen.e: Completed by the end of 7th century and being the largest-scaled among the ancient cities, it was gorgeous, imperial and aristocratic culture around the Fujiwara Capital, which featured genuine Chinese city structure with town design of grid-pattern streets.

Completed around the end of seventh century and being the largest-scaled among the ancient cities, it was a gorgeous, imperial and aristocratic culture around the Fujiwara Capital, which featured genuine Chinese style capital with street plan.
sen.cmt: by→around,7th→seventh,a を補いました。後半部分を文脈より修正しました。
sen.e: Completed around the end of seventh century and being the largest-scaled among the ancient cities, it was a gorgeous, imperial and aristocratic culture around the Fujiwara Capital, which featured genuine Chinese style capital with street plan.

sen.j: 飛鳥浄御原令や大宝律令が制定され、本格的な国家が始動しだした頃でもあった。
sen.e: It was also the time when the Asuka Kiyomihara Code and Taiho Code were established and a full-fledged political entity launched.
It was also the time when the Asuka Kiyomihara Code and the Taiho Code were established, and the genuine nation began.
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。a full-fledged political entity→the genuine nation,launched→began と修正しました。
sen.e: It was also the time when the Asuka Kiyomihara Code and the Taiho Code were established, and the genuine nation began.

sen.j: 初唐文化の影響や朝鮮半島、インド、西アジア、中央アジアの文化も影響した。
sen.e: It was affected by the culture of early Tang, the Korean Peninsula, India and western and central Asia.
It was affected by the culture of early Tang, the Korean Peninsula, India and West and Central Asia.
It was affected by the culture of early Tang, the Korean Peninsula, India and West and Central Asia.

sen.j: 天武天皇・持統天皇の時代が中心だが、一部その前の天智天皇・弘文天皇時代を含む部分もある。
sen.e: The culture flourished most at the time of Emperor Tenmu and Emperor Jito, but included some of the time of their predecessor, Emperor Tenchi and Emperor Kobun.
The culture flourished most at the time of the Emperor Tenmu and the Emperor Jito, but included some of the time of their predecessors, the Emperor Tenchi and the Emperor Kobun.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。predecessor→predecessors と修正しました。
sen.e: The culture flourished most at the time of the Emperor Tenmu and the Emperor Jito, but included some of the time of their predecessors, the Emperor Tenchi and the Emperor Kobun.
Establishment of the Ritsuryo codes
Establishment of the Ritsuryo codes
Establishment of the Ritsuryo codes

sen.j: 中国大陸の高度な文明制度を取り入れて、本格的な国家が誕生した。
sen.e: A full-fledged political entity launched adopting highly-civilized system from mainland China.
The genuine nation launched adopting highly-civilized system from mainland China.
sen.cmt: A full-fledged political entity→The genuine nation と修正しました。
sen.e: The genuine nation launched adopting highly-civilized system from mainland China.

The Asuka Kiyomihara Code
The Asuka Kiyomihara Code

sen.j: 大宝律令は、701年（大宝 (日本)元年）に完成し、直ちに施行された。
sen.e: Taiho Code was completed in 701 and enforced immediately..
Taiho Code was completed in 701 and enforced immediately..
Taiho Code was completed in 701 and enforced immediately..

sen.j: 藤原宮の内裏（だいり）と朝堂院（ちょどういん）
sen.e: The Imperial Palace of the Fujiwara Capital and Chodo-in Office.
The Imperial Palace and Chodo-in (government offices) of the Fujiwara Capital
sen.cmt: Office→(government offices) と修正しました。オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: The Imperial Palace and Chodo-in (government offices) of the Fujiwara Capital

sen.j: 大官大寺（だいかんだいじ）や薬師寺の裳階（もこし）つきの東塔
sen.e: Taikandai-ji Temple and Yakushiji Toto (east pagoda) with mokoshi (double-roof structure).
Daikandai-ji Temple and Yakushi-ji Temple Toto (east pagoda) with mokoshi (double-roof structure)
sen.cmt: Taikandai-ji→Daikandai-ji,Yakushiji→Yakushi-ji Temple と修正しました。ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: Daikandai-ji Temple and Yakushi-ji Temple Toto (east pagoda) with mokoshi (double-roof structure)
Yamada-dera Temple (Jodo-ji Temple)
Yamada-dera Temple (Jodo-ji Temple)
Yamada-dera Temple (Jodo-ji Temple)
It is located in Yamada, Sakurai City.
It is located in Yamada, Sakurai City.
It is located in Yamada, Sakurai City.

sen.j: 蘇我倉山田石川麻呂が発願して倉山田家の氏寺として建立した寺である。
sen.e: SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro reared it as the Uji-dera Temple (temple built for praying clan's glory) of the Kurayamada family at his wish.
SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro reared it as the Uji-dera Temple (temple built for praying clan's glory) of the Kurayamada family at his wish.
SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro reared it as the Uji-dera Temple (temple built for praying clan's glory) of the Kurayamada family at his wish.

sen.j: 石川麻呂は、蘇我馬子の孫、蘇我倉麻呂の子で、大化5年（649年）に異母弟の蘇我日向（ひむか）に讒訴され、造営半ばの山田寺で自殺した。
sen.e: Ishikawakamaro, a grandchild of SOGA no Umako and a son of SOGA no Kuramaro, was falsely charged by his younger paternal half-brother SOGA no Himuka and killed himself at Yamada-dera Temple.
Ishikawakamaro, a grandchild of SOGA no Umako and a child of SOGA no Kuramaro, was falsely charged by his younger paternal half-brother SOGA no Himuka, and killed himself at Yamada-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: son→child と修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: Ishikawakamaro, a grandchild of SOGA no Umako and a child of SOGA no Kuramaro, was falsely charged by his younger paternal half-brother SOGA no Himuka, and killed himself at Yamada-dera Temple.
It is a temple of tragedy.
